This is an economic stress deck that tries to stretch the runner to rez cards and then parasite them away or sacrifice them to get rid of the caissa.

name: um what have i done
description: I made an attempt at first jinteki deck man are they poor.

name: HBFA
HB Biotic IRS
description:
My corp deck I used in the regionals at Dragonslair in Stockholm. It did pretty well. It is a taxing FA deck, with mostly cheap taxing ICE. Tax the runner to the poor house and score out of hand or in your taxing remote.

You can score 2-points agendas directly from hand with: 1) Efficiency Committee + Shipment from SanSan 2) SanSan City Grid behind your remote. 3) Biotic Labor

If you need money, you can install Adonis in your protected remote. If the runner still trashes it, it will work in your favor in the end, a poor runner can't run against you.

If you get a chance to over-advance Vitruvius, do it. It speeds up the endgame considerably by letting you get Biotics/shipment from the heap. It also helps against noise.

The money assets are mostly there to make the runner poor. But if they don't trash it, you can reap the benefits.The same is true with SanSan city grid. Damned if you do, damned if you don't.

Don't be afraid if the runner starts to steal agendas in the beginning, this deck is deadly in the endgame. The winner is the one getting 7 agenda points, not first to 6 points.

name: Tennin 1.0
description: Work in progress

name: Donuts and Fatale Vamps
Bonzai Buddy, Free Toolbars and Dolphin Screensavers (v.1)
description:
"Unless you're name is Thomas Haas, NEVER let your mother use the company computers!"

This is my first deck, so any constructive criticism would be greatly appreciated! I built this deck with the goal of comboing as many virus counters onto my cards as possible, grabbing as many cards from the central servers as possible. Some of the weakness is the lack of Icebreakers and a lack of card draw, as well as the Corp spending it's turn to purge. Thanks for reading!

League & Tournament winner in Gen-X Madrid.

Bon appetit ;)

League & Tournament winner in Gen-X Madrid.

Good economy combined with ice of average cost and a good set of meat damage spiced with a few tags.

name: reina-whiskey-neat v0.3
description: Realized the deck will most likely never win by just grabbing agendas, Data Dealer creates an opportunity to exploit Shi-Kyu and get money. Everything else is meant to make rezzing ICE an unfun day.

name: Stirling Remote Control v1
Only the Strong Survive
description: Coming from a staunch HB player since I started playing last year. I bought Creation and Control box set and never looked back. I started by playing NEXT, before switching over to ETF. I've always been intrigued by identities that were considered weak. Looking at the base ability of HB Stronger Together, it would appear to be really good once you get the Bioroid Ice stacked and that truly is the case. Because you are not getting that one credit with installation, Economy at the start is a bit rough if you are used to ETF but once you get your economy up and running you will be laughing. The agendas are chosen to sustain your momentum. Corporate War, Priority Requisition ensure that when you are finished advancing your agendas you don't lose any tempo. Efficiency Committee was initially a Project Vitruvius, which I would over score, I switched to EC because of the synergy it has with MMC. Inazuma works so well with Bioroid ice it is the only ice I have that has three copies (except for Eli of course;)). All of the operations and Assets are there to help you make money so economy should not be a problem. With ths amount of taxing this ice provides, scroring windows will appear and when they do you should be ready to install and advance your agendas. Hive is the only ice that I'm not sold on, Aggressive secretary could also be Ash. I have found after about a half a dozen games, good success with this identity and it definitely isn't the worst identity in the game that is the common wisdom. All I can say is try it out and see how you like it.
